column4: Hong Kong shares inch up as financials gain on 'Bond Connect'
column5: July 3 Financial shares rose in Hong Kong on Monday  on the back of a new bond trading link between Hong Kong and China  but the overall market was largely flat as blue-chips generally underperformed and the service sector slipped.

column4: China stocks dip on slowdown fears; Bond Connect aids Hong Kong shares
column5: SHANGHAI  July 3 China stocks kicked off the mid-year earnings season on a cautious note on Monday  as optimism about companies' interim results was offset by concerns of economic slowdown in the second half and lingering fears of monetary tightening.

column4: Meister's Corvex Management targets Clariant -Bloomberg
column5: July 3 Hedge fund Corvex Management LP  run by activist investor Keith Meister  has built a stake in Clariant AG to undo the Swiss specialty chemical maker's $6.4 billion planned takeover of Huntsman Corp  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing people with knowledge of the matter.

column4: UK startup Curve launches 'financial time travel'
column5: LONDON/NEW YORK  July 3 A London-based startup has joined up with Mastercard Inc to launch a payment card that allows users to retroactively choose a different credit or debit card for a purchase they have already made  in what they called "financial time travel".

column4: Visa and Mastercard potential suitors for Denmark's Nets: analysts

column4: Hedge fund Jana aims to scuttle EQT's buyout of Rice
column5: Activist investor Jana Partners LLC disclosed a 5.8 percent stake in natural gas producer EQT Corp  on Monday and urged the company to abandon its $6.7 billion buyout of rival Rice Energy Inc .

column4: South Africa's Sibanye says production resumes at strike-hit Cooke mine
column5: JOHANNESBURG  July 3 Production has resumed at the Cooke mine of South African precious metals producer Sibanye Gold following the conclusion of a wildcat strike at the operation which erupted almost a month ago  a company spokeswoman said on Monday.

column4: Militia violence shutters Banro gold mine in east Congo
column5: KINSHASA Fighting between the Congolese army and a local militia in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo has forced Banro Corp's Namoya gold mine to suspend all operations and temporarily evacuate its staff  the company said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Militia violence shutters Banro gold mine in east Congo
